history.proof: intros y x z H1 H2. apply plus_star_plus with y. apply H1. qsimpl time: 1 use: star_plus_plus.

ctx: intros y x z H1 H2.
exceptions.exn: In environment X : Type R : relation X y, x, z : X H1 : plus R x y H2 : plus R y z Unable to unify "exists2 y : X, R ?M1522 y & star R y ?M1523" with "star R y z".

ctx: intros y x z H1 H2.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
R: relation X

Goal:
forall y x z : X, plus R x y -> plus R y z -> plus R x z

Premises:
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
plus : forall X : Type, relation X -> relation X
plus_star_plus : forall y x z : X, plus R x y -> star R y z -> plus R x z
star_plus_plus : forall y x z : X, star R x y -> plus R y z -> plus R x z
plus_star : forall x y : X, plus R x y -> star R x y
star_sind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> SProp), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
star_ind : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (P : X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P x x) -> (forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x x0 : X, star R x x0 -> P x x0
Inductive star (X : Type) (R : relation X) : relation X := star_refl : forall x : X, star R x x | S_star : forall y x z : X, R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z Arguments star [X]%type_scope Arguments star_refl [X]%type_scope Arguments S_star [X]%type_scope [R y] _ [z]
star_trans : forall x y z : X, star R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
S_star : forall (X : Type) (R : relation X) (y x z : X), R x y -> star R y z -> star R x z
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope

```coq
intros y x z H1 H2.
apply plus_star_plus with y.
exact H1.
apply star_plus_plus with y.
exact H2.
apply plus_star.
exact H1.
Qed.
